results.title: Golden braid
results.creator_credit: Illumination Films (AU), Film Victoria, Paul Cox, Paul Ammitzboll and Santhana Naidu
results.brief_description: Bernard is an eccentric clockmaker; Terese is the sultry young Salvation Army worker with whom he is having an affair. Obsessed by the past, he finds a golden braid in an 18th century cabinet and immerses himself in the pursuit of a fantasy. It is up to Terese to lure him away from the ghost of the past, reignite their passion and seduce him back to reality.

results.title: Golden beginnings
results.brief_description: Traces the development of Ballarat from the first gold strike in 1851 and the mining period that followed, through its early industrial growth to its present position as a prosperous industrial city. Narrated by John Collins. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Golden Bay
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews, New Zealand National Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: A social study of the occupations, leisure activities, community life and local government of the people of Takaka (South Island, New Zealand) and its surrounding district, Golden Bay. Farming is the main business of the people but the area is linked historically with Abel Tasman’s discovery of New Zealand.

results.title: Gold!
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, WQED and Irwin Rosten
results.brief_description: A journey to various parts of the world to discover how gold is mined, transported, and used, and how it affects our daily lives. Not central to any one subject area but useful as a resource for studies of monetary systems, prejudices, values, religious aspects, etc. Narrated by E.G. Marshall. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Gold the sacred metal
results.creator_credit: Lewis Bushnell, Kena Productions and Jeri Sopanen
results.brief_description: This film is about gold and what people will do for and with it. For gold, the Conquistadors waged wars and with their superior weapons defeated the Latin American Indians. The film shows the descendants of these Indians, the Koguis, who still survive in small villages. Twice a year they dance with golden masks.

results.title: Gold on blue
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: A look at the training and life-styles of the young men who enter “Cresswell”, the Royal Australian Naval College, near Nowra, N.S.W. Shows various aspects of the college from which they will graduate as junior officers.

results.title: Gold is forever
results.creator_credit: Bob Talbot Productions and Bob Talbot
results.brief_description: A film designed to show the strains, stresses, dedication and training methods of marathon runners. Australia’s Derek Clayton features in the film. Highlights his great effort in the Munich Olympic Games, 1972.

results.title: Gold from the sea: epics of salvage
results.creator_credit: A G Harbrow and United Salvage
results.brief_description: Shows the salvaging of gold bullion from the RMS “Niagara” which was struck by a mine off the coast of New Zealand during WWII.

results.title: Gold diggers' ballad: the watercolours of S.T.Gill (1818-80)
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: The famous watercolours by S. T. Gill reflect the optimism and feeling or spirit of the goldrushes. The gold diggers’ expressive faces and activities show the tremendous fever and hunger after gold in the 1850’s in Victoria. The paintings are presented with a background of Australian ballads with guitar accompaniment.

results.title: Going to school in Australia
results.creator_credit: Austarama Television, Nicholas and Kenneth Mott
results.brief_description: A film designed to instruct immigrants to Australia on the nature of the Australian and especially the Victorian education systems. Two representatives in the field of migrant education are questioned about how parents may proceed to enrol their children at school, the different kinds of schools in the Australian system, their various functions and facilities, adult education and several other facets of the education system. Narrated by Barry McQueen.
